column4: hello I'm trying to install build-essential on a hardy based distro could someone pls look at my errors build-essential will not install
have you mixed repositories or installed any debs manually?
yes I have installed something manually with deb
let me look I hope its in my history from term
pastebin the following too: apt-cache policy libc6-dev linux-libc-dev
did you figure out what you installed, because linux-libc-dev is not from the repositories (and it's the problem)
well I doubt it was envy but linux-libc-dev is the problem.  The only issue is, there may be more
I need it so I can get my dual monitors to go to default and really just configure it properly
I'm about to remove the package but if I do will remove g++ and g++ 4.2
I really don't know if I should remove that package especially if its g++
this is odd, I removed the problem package and it completely removed all of them for g++ but, I tried to do a  sudo apt-get install build-essential and I got this, hold for paste
